data.title: Little Falls Community Schools (ISD 482)
data.text:
Little Falls Community Schools will be kicking off the Summer Food program on June 3. Meals are available for individuals up to 18 years of age and will be served at Little Falls Community High School enter door # 1. Meals must be eaten on site.

Meals will be served M, T, W, TH June 3-August 15.

Meals will not be served June 19 and July 4th

Breakfast will be served 7:30 am - 8:30 am

Lunch will be served 11:00 am - 12:15 pm

If you have any questions, please contact Mary Bartlett @ 320-632-2030 or mbartlett@lfalls.k12.mn.us.

Menus will be posted on LFCS District website: https://www.lfalls.k12.mn.us/departments/food-service/summer-food-program-menus

The Groundbreaking Ceremony for the Little Flyers Childcare Center took place on a snowy March morning. This ceremony marks another milestone in Little Falls Community Schools partnership with the City of Little Falls to bring much needed access to childcare to the Little Falls area. #LFCS #FlyerPride

To View the Little Flyers Childcare Center Groundbreaking Ceremony: https://youtu.be/oG5FJQ9Iy2M

Little Falls Community Schools is thrilled to announce the ceremonial groundbreaking of the Little Flyers Childcare Center, a collaborative initiative between the City of Little Falls and the school district. The groundbreaking ceremony will take place on Monday, March 25, at 10:00 a.m., at the early childhood center in Little Falls.

This exciting milestone represents a significant partnership between the City of Little Falls and the school district to address the growing need for accessible and high-quality childcare services in our community. The Little Flyers Childcare Center will provide a nurturing and enriching environment for young learners, supporting families and working parents in our area.

"We are excited to celebrate the groundbreaking of the Little Flyers Childcare Center, which represents the culmination of dedicated efforts and collaboration between the City of Little Falls and our school district," said Greg Johnson, Superintendent of Little Falls Community Schools. "This facility will not only provide essential childcare services but will also foster early childhood development, preparing our youngest learners for future success."

Members of the media are invited to join us for this occasion.

Event Details:

Date: Monday, March 25, 2024

Time: 10:00 a.m.

Location: 300 - 6th Street Southwest, Little Falls, MN (please enter Door 11 on the northwest corner of the building)

We look forward to celebrating this event with our community and partners as we lay the foundation for a brighter future for our children.
